==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|み|くだり|はん|yomi=ko}}

===Etymology===
Literally "three and a half lines". During the [[w:Edo period|Edo period]], a husband could divorce his wife by writing a formalized note consisting of three fixed lines of text.

===Pronunciation===
* {{IPA|/mikudarihan/|lang=ja}}

===Alternative forms===
* {{l|ja|三下り半}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|みくだりはん}}

# a letter of divorce given from a husband to a wife
# divorce
